importance: This work bridges EMO and GPU acceleration. Tensorization enables efficient parallelization, tackling complex robotic control tasks, and scaling populations, offering new avenues for EMO in computationally intensive applications. **MoRobtrol benchmark enhances real-world applicability**.
summary: Tensorization accelerates EMO algorithms on GPUs, achieving up to 1113x speedup and tackles complex robot control via the MoRobtrol benchmark.
takeaways: Tensorization transforms EMO data/operations into tensor representations for GPU acceleration.
Tensorized EMO algorithms achieve significant speedups while maintaining solution quality.
The MoRobtrol benchmark assesses EMO algorithms in computationally intensive robot control tasks.
tldr:
Evolutionary multiobjective optimization(EMO) algorithms face performance limitations due to insufficient parallelism and scalability with increasing problem scales. To address these challenges, this paper focuses on hardware acceleration with advanced computing devices like GPUs. Current research remains focused on relatively simpler tasks. Therefore, a systematic method of parallelization is necessary.

This paper introduces a general tensorization methodology for accelerating EMO algorithms on GPUs. Data structures and operations of EMO algorithms are transformed into tensor representations, enabling GPU computing. Applying the method to NSGA-III, MOEA/D, and HypE achieves speedups up to 1113x. A new multiobjective robot control benchmark, **MoRobtrol**, assesses performance in real-world scenarios. The **tensorized EMO algorithms tackle complex tasks**.
affiliation: Southern University of Science and Technology
